definition: to leave early and return late (idiom)
early/morning/Good morning!/long ago/prematurely

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
evening/night/late
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: These volunteers set out early and return late every day, is very laborious .
sentences.chinese: 这些志愿者每天早出晚归，很是辛苦。

sentences.english: Frost and rain, give evening early to return.
It is about coming in early and leaving late.

definition: to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
all year round
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
busy/bustling
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
all day long/whole day
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]

to start and finish work
